BRAVO: A hired soldier; an assassin; a desperado.
DELTA: The fourth letter of the modern Greek alphabet Δ, δ.
ECHO: A reflected sound that is heard again by its initial observer.
FOXTROT: A ballroom dance with a slow-slow-quick-quick rhythm.
GOLF: A ball game played by individuals competing against one another in which the object is to hit a ball into each of a series of (usually 18 or nine) holes in the minimum number of strokes.
TANGO: A Standard ballroom dance in 4/4 time; or a social dance, the Argentine _____.
VICTOR: The winner in a fight or contest.
